transcript: He remembered the expression Dolokhov's face assumed in his moments of cruelty, as when tying the policeman to the bear and dropping them into the water, or when he chal- lenged a man to a duel without any reason, or shot a post-boy's horse with a pistol. That ex- pression was often on D61okhov's face when looking at him. "Yes, he is a bully," thought Pierre, "to kill a man means nothing to him.
